posts.name: Roger
posts.cooked:
Working with PID Commands.  How can I stop the shuttering of the drive train?

Code: RogerMCT/PIDTest (github.com)

Video: https://youtu.be/uhYQ1vTxJXk

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked:
Start by getting rid of all the gains that aren’t P.

Also make sure that you don’t have two commands running at the same time that are fighting over the motors (check your command requirements!).

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.name: Kaleb Dodd
posts.cooked: Yes start with just P and then add D, usually this happens when the D value is too high and it is fighting to slow down the drive. I would start with a really small value and then keep doubling it or 10x until it starts to do something and then tune from there. Add I at the end.

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked:
Kaleb_Dodd:

Add I at the end.

Ideally, not at all.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.name: vargoose84
posts.cooked: Is this for sure not a wheel scrub thing? Where the wheels are being dragged across the carpet? May I suggest running this on a cart that you turn manually your self to see if you get the same stutter?

posts.name: vargoose84
posts.cooked:
Oblarg:

Also make sure that you don’t have two commands running at the same time that are fighting over the motors (check your command requirements!).

Just to be clear, if ur trying to read a joystick which is claiming zero input and ur also trying to program your turn code, you will experience something like this

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
I would recommend you take a look at the scheduler for your subsystem in the LiveWindow (on Shuffleboard) to see what is running.

Looks to me like you removed your addRequirements() method from the constructor.

posts.name: Roger
posts.cooked: Hey Everyone,  Just wanted to let you know that we got it working!  Thank you for your replies.

posts.name: vargoose84
posts.cooked: inquiring minds want to know: What was the problem!?!?!

posts.name: Roger
posts.cooked:
Actually, there was a lot of things.  First, the output being sent by the PIDController was in the wrong direction, had to reverse it.  Also needed to make a different PIDController values for Turn and Drive.  Also, needed to add MathUtil.Clamp to control power output of the PIDController.  Feel free to take a look at our commands on our play drive train.

FRCTeam5484/Kirbo (github.com)
